result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Robert Terrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Robert Terrell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Counsel to file Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
RECEIVED & FILED: Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Due to victim notification, case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 9-24-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge to Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor."   mld

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Defendant did appear during the afternoon and stated that he overslept.  Court admonished defendant.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-24-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Attorney Steven R. Wiechmann in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant NOT in court.  Case called onthe record at 9:36 am.  Upon the request of defense counsel, Court will stay bench warrant until 4:00 pm, today's date.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a bench warrant.   mld

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to Branch 4 in trial, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-3-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Brian Christopher Hagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Matter was transferred to Br. 40 as Br. 4 is in trial.  Br. 40 involved in a lenghty sentencing and is unable to handle this plea and sentencing.  Matter rescheduled for Plea and Sentencing in Br. 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to br. 4 in trial, case transferred to br. 40 for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.   mld

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-14-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Lyncoya I., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-3-21015 at 8:30 am.  Agred Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lyncoya I

Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Michael Robert Terrell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
